definition: to thoroughly enjoy oneself
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
a breed of horse/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
joyous/happy/pleased
variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
hubbub/clamor/variant of 歡|欢[huan1]
to disperse after a happy time (idiom)/everyone enjoys themselves to the full then party breaks up
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)

sentences.english: Life is proud to do, don't make gold cup for months. Empty.
sentences.chinese: 人生得意需尽欢，莫使金樽空对月。

sentences.english: Year after graduation, seven similar gatherings, Bomb and unfocused.
sentences.chinese: 毕业后一年，七人相约聚会，尽欢而散。

sentences.english: The next year, seven people together again, still thoroughly enjoyed themselves and unfocused.
sentences.chinese: 第二年，七人再次相聚，仍尽欢而散。

definition: to drink and chat merrily (idiom)
to disperse after a happy time (idiom)/everyone enjoys themselves to the full then party breaks up
to enjoy oneself to the full/to one's heart's content
lit. sing to accompany wine (idiom); fig. life is short, make merry while you can
to get thoroughly drunk (idiom)/to get plastered
to sit face-to-face and drink
to raise one's wine cup
to one's heart's content/without restraint
fine time, beautiful scenery (idiom); everything lovely
to drink one's fill
heavily intoxicated
to not go home until drunk (idiom)/let's make a night of it!
to have a few drinks/to drink to one's heart's content
both the guests and the hosts thoroughly enjoy themselves (idiom)
good wine/fine liquor
to drink one's fill
